item.title: Balatro's Next Free Update Adds Eight More Crossovers Today

The Game Awards are mere hours away, but one of the nominees for Game Of The Year, Balatro, isn't waiting for Geoff Keighley to take the stage. Localthunk and PlayStack have announced Friends Of Jimbo 3, a free update to the card-based roguelike which brings eight more friendly faces to face cards for your next run.

The pack was announced in a new trailer starring Ben Starr--the voice off Clive Rosfield in Final Fantasy XVI, Prometheus in Hades II, and more--as the Balatro jester Jimbo. The trailer also introduces all eight guests included in Friends of Jimbo 3, which range from indie hits to robust RPGs.

The list of games included in the Balatro Friends Of Jimbo 3 pack is below:

  • Divinity: Original Sin 2
  • Donâ€™t Starve
  • Enter the Gungeon
  • Cult of the Lamb
  • 1000x Resist
  • Potion Craft
  • Shovel Knight
  • Warframe

Balatro is a roguelike deckbuilder where players use traditional playing cards to score as many points as possible against "blinds." Scores can be multiplied using Joker cards, which provide temporary buffs, as well as Planet and Tarot cards, which add permanent boosts to a particular run.

The surprise indie smash hit launched on consoles and PC in February, with the mobile version following in September. It has seen over 3.5 million downloads since its initial release, and its success has garnered five nominations at The Game Awards, including Game Of The Year, Best Game Direction, and Best Independent Game. It was also one of GameSpot's Top 10 Games Of The Year for 2024.

item.title: Mafia: The Old Country Trailer And Release Date Leak Ahead Of Reveal
item.content:encoded:

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

A trailer for Mafia: The Old Country has leaked along with its release window. It will launch sometime in Summer 2025.

The 15-second trailer show a litany of explosions, gunshots, and knife fights, all taking place in a fictional city called San Celeste, based on Sicily in the 1900s. San Celeste was previously featured in Mafia 2, and Mafia: The Old Country is a prequel to the first game. The game will feature full audio-dubbing tracks in English, French, German, Spanish, Czech, and Russian, as well as Sicilian, to maintain authenticity.

Developer Hangar 13 already confirmed back in August that more information would be shared in December, and the studio already confirmed that it would be showing something related to Mafia: The Old Country at The Game Awards 2024. It's likely that it will be this trailer.

The end of the trailer confirms the Summer 2025 release window, along with its platforms, including PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S. The game's publisher is once again 2K games, which is also going to debut a gameplay trailer for Borderlands 4 at The Game Awards 2024.

Mafia: The Old Country is the latest game in the Mafia series, with the last two entries being 2016's Mafia 3 and 2020's Mafia: Definitive Edition. Developer Hangar 13 has gone through some turbulence over the past few years, including founder Haden Blackman stepping down, as well as a round of layoffs back in 2022.
